title: 34.5 NP-Complete Problems
content:
Section 34.5

NP-Complete Problems

Summary

A collection of important NP-complete problems.

Key Points

  • CLIQUE: is there a k-clique in graph G?
  • VERTEX-COVER: can k vertices cover all edges?
  • HAMILTONIAN-CYCLE: is there a cycle visiting all vertices?
  • TRAVELING-SALESMAN: tour of length â‰¤ k?
  • SUBSET-SUM: subset summing to target value?

Example

All these problems: easy to verify (NP), hard to solve (NP-hard), polynomially equivalent via reductions.

Why It Matters

Recognize NP-complete problems to know when to use heuristics/approximations.
